summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Building Inspection Advisory, Examining and Appeals Board of Dallas is convening a special called meeting on March 5, 2025, at 11:30 A.M. at the Oak Cliff Municipal Center. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss and make decisions regarding updates to the cityâ€™s building codes and regulations.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of minutes from the previous meeting held on January 21, 2024.
2. Review and recommendations for adopting the 2023 National Electrical Code, with amendments, to be integrated as Chapter 56 "Dallas Electrical Code" in the Dallas City Code.
3. Briefing on proposed amendments to the International Residential Code.

**Important Details**:  
The proposed adoption of the 2023 National Electrical Code aims to enhance safety and compliance in electrical installations within the city. Additionally, the amendments to the International Residential Code will address current building practices and standards to ensure they meet the needs of the community.

**Action Items**:  
The Board is seeking approval for the minutes from the previous meeting and recommendations for the adoption of the updated electrical code. Feedback and consensus on the proposed amendments to the International Residential Code will also be solicited during the meeting. Interested parties wishing to speak must register in advance.
